lBEVYzJZG-nKKdG85tCIXw.text: after a long day of gambling, I almost lost all my money, desperate, hungry, upset, I looked at those homeless people on the street, "yeah, I will end up like them" "NO! you are better than them, you have purpose in your life, you must carry on!!" gather my last inner strength, I pulled out my latest google pixel xl 128gb cellphone, "sign, the best smart phone still couldn't beat those slot machines". Examing all the restaurant around, I saw the aloha specialist, looked at my last ten bucks,i went in, nervous, suspicious, I ordered the wonton min, warmth to deepest of my heart, flavor just blooming upon your tongue , oh, did I mention the services? the waitress just like angle, the smiles melt my frozen heart. Satisfied, reenergized. I finally have the courage to pick up my life.  So I went back to casino and lost more money.   THANK YOU ALOHA SPECIALIST!!  CASINO LOSER 4

wetxS2JkdFshH2Ghx5xoGQ.text: Located in the California Hotel in downtown Las Vegas we come here EVERY TIME we're in town.  Whether with family or friends it's a spot we hit for lunch or dinner.  Run and managed by Hawaiians it's as authentic as it gets.  The food is legit and I think we've tried practically everything on the menu.  From spam and eggs, Saimin, loco moco, spam musubi, poke, teriyaki items, mahi mahi, salmon, garlic chicken, Hawaiian sun drinks, and much much more. I don't think we've had anything we didn't like. They always give generous portions so it's perfect for sharing. Their plates are literally the size of a serving platter!   They are located on the second level across Lappert's ice cream.  Visa and Master Cards accepted.

JtAUb3nfb3ym09p43KgaIQ.text: Cashier is dumb af. She refused to let me pay in cash and the rest on my card. When the other associates said they would show her how; this bishhhh refused. And said that she it was too much of a hassle and she had no time for that. This bishhhh is the rudest cashier I've ever came across and the food isn't even all that great.

fIy5sIbCjIRHqR3qP9Tk9A.text: Yum - get my Curry Fix here!  I Love the location too.  This time, I had chicken and tofu saimin.

IKmK-SYgkP_axBMr4E7Imw.text: Another popular plate lunch favorite is Kalua Pig & Cabbage. Pork is seasoned with Hawaiian salt and slow roasted. In Hawaii, the whole pig is laid out on chicken wire and stuffed with hot lava rocks to start the cooking from the inside. The pig is placed in an imu (underground oven with hot lava rocks) and covered with banana leaves and buried for the day. When it is done, the pig is pulled from the imu and the pork is juicy and tender. At this point, the kalua pig is eaten or stored for later use. Kalua Pig and Cabbage is a great way to use the pork. The rich, salty pork works well with the cabbage when cooked together. The cabbage and pork juice is great on sticky rice as well. Mac salad is served alongside for a creamy flavor.   Teri Beef Sandwich is also a quick lunch stable. The teriyaki flavor was good, but the beef portion was kind of small. One more slice would be better.

PAjIg-A6HHzRMpDmrQVZ9A.text: I ordered the Chicken and Tofu Saimin. I've never had saimin before so I didn't know what to expect. It looked like ramen but the noodle texture was a lot more tough as if it was not fully cooked all the way. The broth was good but salty. I ended up just drinking the soup and eating the chicken and tofu. This place is really out of the way since it's not on the strip. I probably will not be back. :(

photos.caption: Photo of Aloha Specialties - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Chicken and tofu saimin

yCFEwnqCoeAgEpdb9WgmOQ.text: Not what we were expecting. Tiny dinner with the menu on the wall. Felt more like a fast food restaurant.  Having never had authentic Hawaiian, we didn't know what to expect. We took a tip from other yelp reviewers and ordered.  I honestly can't remember what we ordered. It was different.  Mine came on a school lunch type tray with items separated in the compartments. I would need to try other things on the menu to form a full opinion. I'm willing to give it another try.

2XPJjhypmcr7rVd6mblwXA.text: Let me set the mood  Its 2 p.m the day after New Years eve.  Me and my boyfriend were HUNGOVER damn near still drunk from the night before (Don't judge We're in Vegas people! ) lol Whats better to eat when hungover than some soup....  Walked in and the line wasn't too long maybe 10 people in front of us...  We're both super dizzy, and its so stuffy and hot in there! No air flow at all...  It took us LITERALLY 45 MINUTES just to get to the register to order. Service is VERY slow  They had only two girls working. Both running out food, and only one of them were taking orders so basically she would take a customers order, and then do about 10 minutes of delivering food and waiting on customers already seated.  Anywaaaaaayyyysssss  We ordered 2 Large 'Saimins' & 2 sodas. The total was $27.   (One Soup is more than enough for 2 people to share)  We sit down, our food comes out maybe 15 min later, we ate a few bites, then I see my boyfriend looking at his bowl with a weird face (Weirder than it already is) haha  Me : "what"  Him : "Is that a "F***** Bug"  Yes, Yes its a dammmmmn bug in our soup that we waited almost an hour to order, and eat.  He scooped it out, placed it on a napkin and flagged down the server.   She came, and quickly snatched the napkin out of his hands, crumpled it up, and said I'll refund your food. (as if this happens frequently and she was following a protocol)  Geeezussss...  They refunded his soup, (NOT MINE) even though I told her I no longer wanted mine as well since I was completely grossed out from seeing a bug in his. Our soup looked like it hadn't been touched they were practically brand new I could have sold it to someone standing in line.  Wouldn't come back  I think I'm being nice here and giving 2 stars because I don't want to completely ruin the rating since the flavor of the food is good. But I prefer my meals with less "Natural" proteins. Thank you.

XOok1TgTGFqlbqM1udd6sA.text: I've been wanting to come here for along time as it is a local favorite. I perhaps visited on an off night. I was not impressed. I do want to return to try their oxtail soup.

xpaQ96gHUbsO35SVl42SIA.text: We always stop by and visit this restaurant when in Vegas. It is authentic local food from Hawaii and the employees & customers remind us of being back on the island. I recommend the saimin and aloha bento plate with a side of mac salad.

IIzrtzOtagq7OrD9ueG79g.text: When ever I go to Vegas this is first on my list of places to eat! The amount of food, the quality and the price cannot compare to their competitors. My favorite dish is their chicken tofu saimin, it is so flavorful and hearty. I have them add veggies and it's amazing! It's my go to place in Vegas!

O9qOlLo6ssdUnuxLlJtV2w.text: Honestly one of my top two favorite Hawaiian joints to eat at here in Vegas. The only thing I hated back then was that they did not accept card only cash but now they do. Their saimin is really good (depending on the chef) and their spicy Korean chicken is to die for!!!! My fave thing here and I their mac salad, yum! The boyfriend always gets a combination plate with three different meats and he enjoys it very much. Over all love this place, it is always busy but service is fast. A wonderful hidden gem aside from Ross J's. Best two Hawaiian places in Las Vegas .

ESjl8lWsO-U-GXdLjqxvmw.text: Love this place - such a gem. I went here with my friends family and I plan on coming back every time I'm in vegas. The service and food is amazing.  It's a more casual restaurant but the food and people is what draws you in. It's a place packed with "aunties and uncles". They give generous portions of food so come with an appetite. The Mac salad to the bread are delicious. They have an extensive menu with wallet friendly prices.

photos.caption: Photo of Aloha Specialties - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Spam musubi

ciR-6m_gH5qpXP08Z56GRg.text: MUST GET: Saimin with wontons.  I was recently introduced to Aloha Specialties. I was totally blown away the second I tasted the saimin. So much so that I came two days in a row. I'd recommend getting the small size. It's already pretty big. Get it with wontons! The noodles is simple really. It's a perfect cure to a long night filled with good memories and alcohol. The broth is very plain yet so crisp it makes you want to smack your tongue. You get a deep bowl filled with crinkly noodles, bbq beef and wontons. The wontons are heavily wrapped with wonton noodle and the meat inside was just divine. Again, nothing about these bowl of noodles will jump out at you and attack you with flavor. It's simple. It's satisfying.  Pair the saimin with an order of spam musubi. It's just a great combination!  Expect long lines at peak munching times.

photos.caption: Photo of Aloha Specialties - Las Vegas, NV, United States. 2x orders of spam musubi and a side of mac salad.
Photo of Aloha Specialties - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Saimin w/ wontons and no green onions.

4_XS7m-TU5TqdNterAKdGw.text: Love this little restaurant in the California Hotel and Casino. I know this is a popular hotel with Hawaiian locals but I had never checked it out prior to this visit to Las Vegas. I love that I saw food on the menu that I was well acquainted with. I got the mix plate, it was a good choice. The kids got spam musubi, which is always a hit. I will definitely try to stop at this place more often.

74C9MIVx2TZv0A3SaqJCxg.text: Surprisingly good!   It was like street food in Hawaii

43yxU6XhYlAV8iNv6UILAQ.text: Came here to have dinner three nights ago with my family. I was soooo excited because i saw great reviews for this place and im a local girl from Hawai'i so Hawaiian food is always on my mind when going somewhere to eat.  I have to say i was disappointed after reading reviews then trying out the food. The teriyaki sauce was NOT good. I got the local plate. The spam musubi's was good but thats it.   Also, they didnt have Poke which i was shocked after seeing pictures on here of poke.   I'll get my hawaiian fix elsewhere. It was an experience though.

MXiiMQdU9HWm6p4B4mPvtA.text: I'm surprised there aren't more reviews for this place!  I have been coming to Aloha Specialties since I was a kid.  My dad was born in Hawaii so we are always on the hunt for some good local food.  Aloha Specialties is one of the must eats when my family or bf comes to Vegas.    I usually get the Garlic Chicken and Ahi Poke (when they have it).  The garlic chicken is a pretty hefty plate with three breaded and fried chicken thighs slathered with brown gravy.  I love anything with brown gravy and I like my dark meat.  Like I said, a heavy meal... take a nap after eating this.  The ahi poke is on the specials list and isn't always there.  If you see it you should get it!  Large hunks of fresh tuna and onion soaked in sesame oil and soy sauce goes great with a bowl of plain white rice.  Better than sushi!  It is always a bummer when they run out or don't have any poke.  My brother is a big fan of their Loco Moco.  Too much hamburger meat for me but he loves it.  I usually get a fruit punch to wash it all down and complete my local style lunch or dinner.  The hours are kinda limited for a Vegas eatery... they close at 9pm or 10pm.  Be safe and come for a yummy lunch.  If you are still on the prowl for some good local food in the wee hours after dancing your butt off at a club, I would head downstairs to the 24 hour Market Street Cafe for some dang good Oxtail soup.  The Cal has it all!  Lotsa good food for a great price.  If you have relatives from Hawaii like I do, you may run into them gambling the slots downstairs.  Say hi to Auntie for me!

fH_dD44phj5e9pV3Xh8ZYQ.text: Came here to try spam musabi for the first time. It was amazing. The spam was nice and crisp. Can't wait to return

RXI9cUq66gsKyZS0iiHDUw.text: Felt the need to update my review as I just came back from a trip to Vegas and saw that they renovated! My mom refused to believe me. Food is still good as ever, and the people still make me feel like I'm home in Hawaii. Except now there is a little more room to sit and the whole place just looks so clean and new. It also seems like the casino smells less smoky even. Can't wait to eat here again!

7-k_6b01LmFjE5rP1SvfBA.text: Been coming here since I was a kid and when it was located where the restrooms are now! Lol.  Never ever had a bad meal here! Ever! Always fast, always fresh, always on point Hawaiian food! I go here at least 2 times a month! I'd go every week if it wasn't where it's at but its all good. Love this place!!!!!!!!

kl4JTSFYzJhhip43waDt9g.text: We've been coming here for a very long time and it never fails us! I love the service here and the food is even better! There is such a good vibe here, I usually get the kalbi ribs and they are the best! Their Mac salad is great too. I've also gotten the lumpia and garlic chicken with gravy and that's great as well!

7uRRYi_pjuCpa6SQg-ChJQ.text: Good food.  The service is kinda so-so.  You wait in a long line to order and then set yourself.  No refills on drinks.  They recently remodeled and the prices went through the roof.  Don't expect too much and don't expect a budget meal.

goTZ9RnFO5DlLVbcHC86lA.text: Omahgah definitely getting bang for your buck! Large portions at decent prices. As soon as I arrived in Vegas for my friend's bday, we had lunch at Aloha. Dining area was full, line was at the door, folks enjoyed their dishes amongst the chatter. I debated on one of the specials: mix of chicken & beef teriyaki, plus spam musubi, but changed my mind last minute to a mahi mahi plate and a side order of musubi. I was in the mood for crispy fish, but the 3 filet portion I received was dipped in something akin to pancake batter. Clean cut white fish went well with dabs of tartar sauce, but wasn't the texture I was looking for. So much rice! Couldn't even finish a quarter of it. Musubi was ok, more sweet sauce than I'm used to. A friend commented the spam was salty in her egg plate. Another friend ordered the pork (soft) tofu, it's a sweetened brothy dish in a bowl. Saimin noodle soup looked good! Lacking meat though.  Lots of Hawaiian options, didn't get to try the coconut haupia dessert because we got Lappert's ice cream across the walkway. Get in line, order at the counter, wait for your food to be brought out. They accelerate table turn around rate by posting signs not to save tables. Polite staff. Grab a bite during gambling breaks, if that's your thing.

Photo of Aloha Specialties - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Full lunch table! Mahi, pork tofu, bento, spam &amp; eggs, spam musubi

RSOpEY7-x38ekvPux2743Q.text: An absolute stop in vegas! I usually get the kalua pork plate with masubi and gravy on the side

vJk09vmmd_tQJNe9CUZ6Yw.text: Always remember to stop by here for at least ONE of your meals or you definitely missed a good one! Super fast service! Never disappointed by foodstuff. Just like home, comfort food. Big portions you can easily share unless hung over.

photos.caption: Photo of Aloha Specialties - Las Vegas, NV, United States

KFDWISZ1yJp1LXJ0rzI1Kw.text: Talking about hidden gems, this place shines bright.  Located on the 2nd fl., inside the California hotel, in downtown Vegas.  After a night of buffets and losing all your money, this is a really nice place to come to, to end your stay here in Vegas.  Pure Asian comfort food at its best.    Teriyaki beef and chicken, loco moco, soup noodles, spam musubi, curries, and a wide variety of bentos box's and rice bowls, all tasting great, had that home cook taste to it.  Friendly and attentive staff.  The place is clean, simply decorated.    Also a big plus, casino is located just outside the restaurant, for any last minute gambling urges.  Tables are cheaper to play, and the slots seems a little  looser here.  We are definitely going to make this a tradition of making this place our last stop, before heading back to LA.

QW7s72KC8SpWw4Nns3CwXA.text: I moved to the Midwest for college and haven't had very many opportunities to go back home to Hawaii but a recent Vegas trip was enough to satisfy a lot of my food cravings. Aloha Specialties is hands down the number one place in Vegas for local food and was definitely a must-stop for us. I even took some of my college friends here to experience the foods I grew up with and they enjoyed it as well.   The space (a lot like the rest of the California) has seen some needed upgrade since my high school days -- check out those floors and that fancy looking menu board! It's a pretty big space but still always busy and there's a line pretty much no matter what time of day you go. You order at the counter and they bring your food out to your table. The atmosphere is casual but inviting, due in part to the friendly staff and in part to hearing the chatter of all the other patrons. There is something so comforting and familiar about eating here after years of being away from home. Food was a little slow moving from the kitchen to the dining room but we didn't mind at all.   Between everyone at our table we got the kalua pork cabbage, saimin, teriyaki combo, mix plate, and teriyaki steak. Most of the plates come with rice and mac salad. The portions are HUGE and we had a hard time finishing everything. I ordered the kalua pork and cabbage and dat buggah was ono! It was really moist and had a good cabbage to pork ratio. I also tried my friend's saimin which was also HUGE and it was pretty good, the broth wasn't too salty and the noodles were good and chewy. There is also Aloha Shoyu on the tables so a huge plus for that.   It's clear why this one is a favorite for so many Hawaii people and I'll definitely be back on my next Vegas trip!  TL;DR: Big portions, cheap prices, friendly service, good food. My only complaint is the mac salad is pretty bland but everything else is so good that it makes up for that!  P.S. They'll validate your parking here too! If you wanna do the Fremont Street Experience it's a good way to save on parking costs if you're already planning on eating in the area anyway!

photos.caption: Photo of Aloha Specialties - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Kalua pork and cabbage

HGGOy4tUSKNCW4E9J2UTgQ.text: Recently had a family vacation and while staying at the Mainstreet Hotel I got food poisoning from another hotels food and when I finally felt like eating it was a must eat Saimin day so we headed to Aloha Specialties and man what a difference we got the customer service could use a little help but they took my order and brought it outside the doors  to our table. And the best part was that the food was really good especially for my stomach since I wasn't feeling too well. The prices are okay too. We visited around 11 am so the lines wasn't too bad.

GucRpauNzlDGaMetokjXww.text: (+) Korean Chicken (+) Kalua Pig & cabbage  Every year I play in a basketball tournament in Las Vegas, and I have stayed at the California Hotel for 4/5 of the times I've gone. Therefore, I've eaten here and sometimes multiple times during the weekend. Aloha Specialties is located within the hotel, and my friend told me something about the Hotel being Hawaiian owned, or something along those lines. With that in mind, Aloha specialties is the real deal when it comes to good Hawaiian food.   Food: Oh man, I've had almost everything on the menu. A couple of my favorites are the korean chicken, teriyaki steak, and the kalua pig and cabbage. Honestly, you couldn't go wrong with any entree you choose. The korean chicken is my favorite because it has a kick of spiciness, and the chicken skin is nice and crispy. The marinade they use is to die for. If you love spicy food, try the korean chicken first! The kalua pork is tender and they have always done it right!  The portions are great, but the amount of rice they give you is excessive. If you like rice, you'll like all the rice. :)  Service: You order at the counter, and the servers will bring the food to you.

photos.caption: Photo of Aloha Specialties - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Teriyaki steak plate with a side order of spam musubi

WqBZDUStL9LkloY5CIX77Q.text: We been coming here for years each time we're in Vegas and enjoyed it each time but on a recent visit (April 2019), two of us who are sensitive to large amounts of MSG became ill after eating here. This has never happened to us before so it leads us to believe there's been a change in the kitchen. Has anyone else sensitive/allergic to MSG have a similar experience after eating here? Too bad since we always made it a point to eat here when we're in downtown. We have another trip to Vegas in a few months and will give it one more try...

kCnBAI9oE_WRXBoMS4AD2w.text: Light snack some drinks "Ox Tail Soup" POGIBALLS overall rating 4 Stars Food 4 Stars Service 4 Stars Restaurant Cleanliness 4 Stars Restroom 3 Stars       This soup was the perfect dish for after a  night of drinks.  The meat on this oxtail was falling off the bone and very tender and juicy. A little too much fat but still the broth mixed with the meat and the vegetables made the dish very good. This soup accompanied with some steamed white rice made it a perfect after midnight snack.       I would dine in here again. @Aloha Specialties / California Casino,  Las Vegas

photos.caption: Photo of Aloha Specialties - Las Vegas, NV, United States
Photo of Aloha Specialties - Las Vegas, NV, United States
Photo of Aloha Specialties - Las Vegas, NV, United States

NPEuukAPuvG7VaKB36QyAg.text: Aloha Specialties is by far still my favorite place to go to in Vegas every time I visit. There isn't a trip that I've gone on where we haven't stopped by here. With the exception of their newly renovated restaurant.   So they closed for almost 3 months to renovate, and I was devasted during this time. When they finally opened again, I was ecstatic! Keep in mind, I don't live in LV, so for us to come here EVERY time we visit is considered a big deal.   The reason why I'm updating my review is because of Mutya. She's the sweetest employee ever! She remembers our order (maybe because it's so customized) every time I walk in. She's such a hard worker and I get sad whenever she's not here to greet me. She always makes sure I have everything I need especially for my takeout order!  I can't say enough about her and her service, but I hope this business keeps going strong forever because I can't see a trip to Vegas without it!

FuE549BJJFU0Ikd6Ff9JnA.text: We love this place! Located upstairs in The California Hotel & Casino.  We've been here for breakfast and dinner and it never disappoints.  Great local Hawaiian flavors and huge portions.  My personal favorite is the Portuguese sausage and eggs breakfast.  The saimen is also a favorite.    Try Aloha Specialties out, you'll be glad you did!

photos.caption: Photo of Aloha Specialties - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Portuguese Sausage, eggs, and rice!

pbh8YUVDaMjNdm-n2s-vEA.text: We always enjoy the Hawaiian plate lunch food at Aloha Specialties when we visit the California in downtown Las Vegas. They give you a large quantity of food, particularly the amount of rice! I especially enjoyed the mahi mahi on the mixed plate special, the fish was tasty, moist and had a nice light batter with perhaps a little too much tartar sauce. Since we split two entrees three ways I also got to sample my mother-in-law's Portuguese sausage. Pretty yummy.   If you're looking for cheap eats and like Hawaiian plate lunch type fare, you could do worse than Aloha Specialties. It felt kinda similar to Rainbow Drive In in Honolulu.   Four stars.

photos.caption: Photo of Aloha Specialties - Las Vegas, NV, United States
Photo of Aloha Specialties - Las Vegas, NV, United States

tEOGUjS5XQT0x4BXuoF4XQ.text: Saimin noodles was way over cooked, spam musubi had more rice than normal with a small thin piece of spam.  The Teri beef was good. Prices are a little high --Plates look big but it's mostly rice.  The staff was very friendly and polite.

WmXQklazRmOlU0vlaPA0WA.text: I got the teriyaki chicken bowl and my boyfriend got spicy Korean chicken. Both dishes were delicious! I preferred mine because the sauce was so good. Both dishes were very large so we probably could have split one and both felt full afterward. The prices are very affordable but the food is 10/10. I am very happy that I tried this place. I will come back here any time I come to Vegas in the future!

photos.caption: Photo of Aloha Specialties - Las Vegas, NV, United States

LJMtbuS5gzGNu3mmbLURsQ.text: Love the Aloha bento. Portion is huge and perfect for sharing. You Must get the saimin. Just like home. Place gets very busy. Come here atleast once a month.

gZCvjAEOqnt6UUfJZRcb7Q.text: thank God my gout tells me when i've had enough to eat. otherwise, i would be eating here more than i should!  this place was so good. and the prices were amazing. i only ordered the Loco Moco, but, seemingly, everyone in there looked pleased (and stuffed) with their orders, which was bountiful. no skimping in this place. so many island options to choose from. i was hoping to try out the oxtail soup, but, the gout was not going to let me have a crack at this trip.   located on the second floor mezzanine of The Cal, this place does get pretty full with long lines in the mornings. but, turn around was quick and staff was very friendly. would definitely come back if we were in the area again.

photos.caption: Photo of Aloha Specialties - Las Vegas, NV, United States. No Mo&#39; Loco Moco.
Photo of Aloha Specialties - Las Vegas, NV, United States

SY42A-KOn9JTO41FngzMUg.text: Ordered the Loco Moco the gravy was a little to sweet for me but still delicious. The suppose to be Over easy egg was more of a over medium-egg so that was kind of a disappointment. Over all can't go wrong with the prices.

photos.caption: Photo of Aloha Specialties - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Loco Moco

jif7Uimf_h3rs_HD-yRMZQ.text: Finally had a chance to check out this spot on our last visit to Downtown Vegas. The 1st time we went to Downtown Vegas, they were remodeling and it was closed.  So, we went on our last day and parked at the California Hotel and Casino and please keep your parking ticket with you since you can validate and pay only $5 bucks or something. Okay, so the lady at the counter was really funny too. Our # was # 2 and then I asked, oh, so were # 2 and she said yes, since I'm #1. Clever lady!!! I went with the Aloha Special which came with teriyaki beef, a musubi and mac salad. The musubi was alright but their mac salad is freaking amazing!! My hubby went with the bento box and loved every bite of it. The fish, the spam the fish cake.  We will be going back in October and I will try the Loco Moco, hopefully I wake up early enough to catch breakfast.

photos.caption: Photo of Aloha Specialties - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Bento Box - the Hubbys
Photo of Aloha Specialties - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Yelp Check-IN
Photo of Aloha Specialties - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Aloha Specialties Bento Box

-GZAA0R58vF0mHO9r2kApQ.text: Whenever I'm in Vegas with my family and friends, Aloha Specialties at The California Hotel and Casino is our go-to spot. This is the Hawaiian restaurant upstairs, right across the famous and delicious Lapperts ice cream shop. I've never seen this place empty, this place is always packed and the line is out the door. I really love their new look, they've remodeled and updated their restaurant with newer seats and tables, paintings are nicer and the service is faster. I also love that their fruit punch still tastes like Malolo brand Hawaiian style.  I normally go for their Portuguese Sausage and Eggs (sunny side up) with a side of Mac Salad... It's the closest thing to feeling like your in Hawaii, ordering from Zippy's or the Rainbow Drive-In. Another favorite is their Saimin which comes with noodles, fish cakes and wonton. They also have really good combo platters, they have a choice of Kalbi short ribs, chicken/pork Katsu, bbq pork, beef/chicken teriyaki, which comes with white rice and macaroni salad. Make sure to save enough room in your tummy for some yummy dessert at Lapperts ice cream and try their tasty flavors like their macadamia nut ice cream!

GkXccib-EjkoX4mlB5SUug.text: Newly remodeled but the line is worst than when it wasn't remodeled.  Cashier moves in a speed of turtle .  They don't care there's a line...customer service isn't was it used to be.  We got here at 2:15 after lunch crowd- so we think but it'a nearly a 20 min wait to place your order & another 20 mins to get your food.  Cost of food has gone up.  I don't mind it if it wasn't a pain to stand in line & see how slow the cashier work.

tWgHBN0K7C_Cg5Mu3W-zNw.text: Kinda late on this review but it's too yummy to not leave one!   Important things:  - it's located on the 2nd floor of California hotel - not sure how much parking costs but if you come late enough there's no charge  - cash only!  - prices: pretty cheap $8-$9 an entree  - order & seat yourself kind of place   Yummm we got the breakfast platter that included rice, luncheon meat, spam, and Portuguese sausage. All were soo yummy! Great place for breakfast! They also have lunch and dinner entrees. They give you a generous amount of rice and it's pretty authentic Hawaii food. They kind of take a while for the food to come out but we were a party of 7 so that might be why, overall not too long of a wait.    Overall, super yummy breakfast ! Great place for Hawaiian food :)

HwO0mC9SwSj8EPpQ4kgc9w.text: Wait i can't believe i didn't write a review for this place since i always eat here everytime i visit Vegas. Good Hawaiian local flavor food here although i will admit ever since they remodeled way back when when they connected the bridge from California Hotel and Main Street Hotel the food quality went down a bit it but still enjoy it. My favorite is the breakfast eggs,rice and Portuguese sausage then the saimin and spam musubi and then the bento box. This place can get really packed around the lunch and dinner time sometimes the line goes out the door best bet is to go off normal lunch and dinner hours regular or Hawaiian time lol.

rWUirytE1euZSFZGGms99w.text: Impressed with the Renovations. Very nice and open. Buy why did you go back to "Cash Only"...I mean it's almost 2017.

bfU5ciTSmobtk3V1-YZoLA.text: So since we got here there has been a line out the door, so you know it good. I love places that our 100% authentic. The servers and the cooks are all Hawaiian, and the line of people out the door, they're Hawaiian also. I got my staple loco moco and the Korean chicken, best I ever had! This place is awesome.

photos.caption: Photo of Aloha Specialties - Las Vegas, NV, United States

zuOokPJPPcBOzymUFZW0SA.text: As I already stated I have been coming to Aloha specialties for over 10 years. In the last year, coincidentally around the time the owner died, I think it was the owner.. whatever the case, in the last year this place has taken a turn for the worse. The food is progressively getting horrible, the wait times are long, I will go back but i don't think It will be anytime soon, sad day.

PtumpQJkZPV9aBIDQNB4Zg.text: Growing up in Hawaii, I am VERY particular about my hawaiian food.  I must say, Aloha Specialties hits the spot!  I'm in love with their korean chicken!  Very well marinated, a little kick to it and very juicy! Their Saimin is sooooo good also!  I love the noodles in their saimin.. slightly firm but perfect chewiness to it. Their breakfast plate (Portuguese Sausage Eggs and Rice)... so yummy!  You cant go wrong with Portuguese sausage eggs and rice, ever!  I can do without their Teri beef burger... I dont feel its authentic enough (its a beef patty with sauce thrown on it. No Thanks).   Their portions are relatively generous... so you'll definitely be satisfied!  Staff is friendly, giving it that "home" feeling.    Keep in mind that this is a cash only venue.

rmQKKo1fJzEUgOlTEvInng.text: Located on the 2nd floor of the California Hotel. If it weren't for the long wait times to get your food and CASH ONLY, this place would be 5 stars in my book. The food portions are huge and decently priced. You know this place is authentic when you see an abundance of Hawaiian customers.   I love the food here, but I still haven't forgiven them for making me miss my flight. The day after some qt and barhopping with the bff, he was craving Hawaiian and thought we had time to grab some lunch here before taking me to McCarran. It would've been True if we went somewhere else!!  We ordered our food to-go and waited about 50 mins until we got it. The wait is ridiculous! Of course I missed my opportunity to check in on time and I had to scramble to find another flight. I had the most expensive spam musubis ever that day hahah ($180 for last minute flight to LAX).

D5r7SIBsaz18bHBZ5oiDqQ.text: Be aware of "C" rating The order taker hands out cups lip side down on counter where people put their money  very unsanitary. Limited menu a lot of island favorites gone. Personnel not friendly. Tables not cleaned off immediately for such a small place. I saw a server pick up a dropped fork and place it back in the usage bin. Plus is new fountain station not limited to one drink. New decor.

Oxy7tAOP6nOjDSw2KrDpTg.text: I love this place!   I must return next week.    Hawaiian food plate, its just so tasty.  The macoroni salad was insane, the terriaki beef out of this world with this sweet gravy on it, and the rice was a perfect match for soaking up the beefy gravy.   I ate my whole plate, was not stuffed, just satisfied.   Happy, ready to swim at Hanalei Bay in Kauai, but back to the 9th Island Vegas!  Thank you Aloha and see you again soon....brahdahs and sisters....  5 STAR HAWAIIAN DELI PLATES HERE!!  Cheap and yummy!   Inside the California Hotel

1itWlxhDsuHHbr4DoNYXdw.text: Aloooha!  Alright back to writing reviews from our roadtrip.  I think all the reviews hit the mark with this restaurant...esp if you're a local from the HI....it's no Zippy's but when in Vegas, will take it.  Staying in the California Hotel aka the 9th island, it was great having a place like this to go to especially if you've been on the mainland for quite some time. Got myself a spam musubi and the aloha bento special...definitely not a place to go to if you're on a diet...was laden with fat, sodium and grease like any good ole spam can and made with aloha.  Just remember, this place is technically separate and independent functioning from the hotel so CASH ONLY...no DEBIT, no CREDIT, and you can't charge to your room..it was also super hard finding an ATM around the hotel and the only one I could find is the one downstairs between the main lobby and the entrance to the casinos.

photos.caption: Photo of Aloha Specialties - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Aloha breakfast with sweetbread and loco moco

GPlqRFjaoxfmn3N4bzyyYg.text: We had never eaten Hawaiian food before and we had a great experience here!  I wish I had the time to have gone back. Two complaints- One: too busy for staff to keep up.  We had to wait for quite a bit.  But the line NEVER ran out.  People kept coming!  Must be the food that keeps them coming back instead of the speedy delivery.  Two: you should have pictures of what the menu items are.  There is no way a new customer knows what to order!  I saw some great dishes on other tables that I realllllly wish I had ordered.  But I was clueless.  So research Hawaiian dishes before you go I guess. The food was delicious though.  Very good.

zC2v9HgCvUWaFjNWyreaPQ.text: Great place to get some local kine grinds right on the second floor of the California casino. The way they prepare most of their sauces and meats are legit. Tried the aloha bento, saimin and haupia which made an excellent feast.

photos.caption: Photo of Aloha Specialties - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Aloha bento, saimin, haupia

hxu-rVUV0WZbIAaYUaKYRQ.text: This place is so good! Born and raised in Hawaii, best place to go in Vegas for local food.

VCRMpe4rKdS-rqVZnjVDuw.text: Just got back from Las Vegas for the weekend and of course ate there twice, I even brought some home in my cooler for God's sake. Both times were Absolutely Fabulous and my left-overs are just as good as I type this review.. Maybe it's the memories in California itself with my Dad who has passed away and mom who now is in the late stages of Alzheimer;s and doesn't remember The California? I remember.They both loved that place and all the Hawaiian food they have to offer. Put's all the Orange County Hawaiian BBQ to shame. L & L, The Loft, Hawaiian Teriyaki Taki.........Nothing Compares or even comes close!! Not to mention the Nice Friendly Hawaiian Staff. They all look and make me feel like family. Two Thumbs Up for Sure~!!

F0kmplBqXRUs6frsxY_iiw.text: I used to love this place, but the quality of the food has gotten pretty bad. The beef was super gristley and the silverware barely cut through the thin slice of meat.   I usually always get saimen but decided to try something new. Chicken curry sounded great but was very disappointed when it took an hour to get my food...which was probably sitting in a pot on a stove ready to be served. This was definitely not the curry I was expecting, especially coming from a Hawaiian restaurant. This "curry" was more like a bland gravy with mushrooms and tons of onions.   Every year my family amd I always eat here and its just not the same anymore. I'd rather eat at L&L.

e4UlkyHcP6fY-XvNgBWDQg.text: Big, big portions. The sweet sour spare ribs are the best. And the saimin always fills me up.

u77QulVvDKTCJvKO9Xq7rg.text: Missing home (Hawaii)? Want saimin? Look no further. Every time I come to Vegas and stay downtown, I make a stop here for some local comfort food. This particular time, my family was stopping over on our way home after a weeklong vacation and I was craving some saimin. I was so excited and was not disappointed.  Sometimes the lines can be long to order, but it usually moves. Once you order, you get a number and have a seat at one of the tables. The food is brought to you. So satisfying.  I've gotten other food here, but mostly just get their saimin. It's a nice little bit of home while you're away.

Jnq9bgPXygvkc3mZOIO0mQ.text: Located in the California hotel downtown I'd have never stopped here if it weren't for yelp!  You order your meal at the counter then seat yourself!!  My party's food came out very quickly and not all at once.  The saiman came out first and I enjoyed it a lot!  My Boca plate was ok but the spam was very salty although that should be expectedand the rice had seaweed on it, it wasn't that bad but not my style!  The chicken is breaded and fried, that and the beef were just ok!  I might come back but only for saiman!

photos.caption: Photo of Aloha Specialties - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Saiman
Photo of Aloha Specialties - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Boca plate

gSKy8l2Ez5TaEPQOFIPAGA.text: Great place to go if you're missing local island food! Today we both had the Korean Chicken Plate. As usual, I couldn't finish it all and took most of it home for another meal. Will have it for dinner tomorrow night, since we are having a special Easter dinner tonight.

photos.caption: Photo of Aloha Specialties - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Korean chicken plate

KyL-pyNCTaE8rx3ibTRNuA.text: Always a go-to when I come up to vegas since I usually stay downtown somewhere.  Makes me feel like im back home in Hawaii with the food that they serve.  They also have very big portions for a good price too.  I don't know if its because I usually eat here after a long night of drinking, but the food always tastes great.  They also renovated the restaurant not too long ago so it is more modern looking.  The only thing I don't like about the new set up is that there is only 1 cashier and a few workers.  So there were times where it took half an hour to an hour to get order, even quick orders like spam musubis.  Ill assume they go in order of who orders first, but when you have small orders that can go out quickly, especially to-go orders, they should definitely be faster.  With that being said, the line to order can get very long.  Ill also assume that they only have 1 cashier because their restaurant isn't big and if they have multiple cashiers, they wouldn't have enough seats for the customers.  The last time I came here, I ordered two spam musubis and a loco moco to-go (oh and I wasn't happy that the loco moco didn't have any gravy on it). That quick and simple order took more than 45 minutes to fulfill.  I really hope they are just understaffed because that is unsatisfactory in my eyes.   So if you ever plan on eating here, you definitely will get full off of whatever you order, but beware that it might take a really long time.  So give yourself time to eat here.

fCvCKwISbb15g0Qrk58tTA.text: Got the Aloha Specialty bento and it was sooo filling. The rice was nice, fluffy, and they gave so much. Basic Hawaiian fast food but it hits the spot, most of my group had leftovers for later, and the staff is so nice and helpful. I'd definitely go again!

RBvtmZIcg9vExNRGSNKiSA.text: Pretty average...I had really high hopes for this place. And maybe this rating is a product of those expectations but alpha specialties was just alright. We had the Korean spicy chicken and the combo with the two spam musubis and Teri chicken and beef. So the Korean spicy chicken was pretty good. The mac salad though...too much mayo. The Teriyaki sauce was not good. And the chicken and beef were really dry. The spam musubis though were not bad. All in all this place is average. I will say that their portion size is good. I would come back after an early night of drinking.

photos.caption: Photo of Aloha Specialties - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Inside
Photo of Aloha Specialties - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Spicy Korean Chicken
Photo of Aloha Specialties - Las Vegas, NV, United States

rj66K6o1m7LCnjQi44ehHQ.text: First time ever in Downtown Las Vegas and was looking for some dinner. Yelp and our craving for some hawaiian food took us here! I really enjoyed my experience walking through the casino/hotel that led up to this restaurant. It was very casual and no frills. I ordered the Aloha Sampler which had a little bit of everything. Service took a bit longer than expected but the portions are generous. If I'm ever back in Vegas, I'd make a stop back here.

photos.caption: Photo of Aloha Specialties - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Loco Moco
Photo of Aloha Specialties - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Saimin
Photo of Aloha Specialties - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Spam Masubi

PNoBjREzZO_GiF4l2ghDgg.text: The food is so clutch. They have all of the Hawaiian classics and they're tasty. The only downfall with the place is the wait can be forever at times, otherwise all good.

U-IzdddwLK4otcxwdN7cdQ.text: A visit to Las Vegas is not complete to us until we visit California Hotel and dined at Aloha Specialties. It just isn't. We've been going to Aloha Specialties for as long as I remember.  Saimin soup is my go to dish here. Broth is excellent and noodles are perfect. A good soup for a cold night. Yum yum.   Garlic Chicken is the bomb. Crispy and garlicky goodness. Mac salad was on point. I just have to remember to ask for gravy on the side lol.   Spam musubi for the win. Delicious!!  Service is friendly and fast.  Price is reasonable and its CASH only here.   If you're looking for good True Hawaiian food, look no further. You're in the right restaurant =)

photos.caption: Photo of Aloha Specialties - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Spam Musubi
Photo of Aloha Specialties - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Saimin
Photo of Aloha Specialties - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Local Plate

-3bXKIIkk_8Cr_QBp__74g.text: Came here on a Sunday afternoon after visiting the Natural History Museum. My husband and I used to come here back in the 2000's to eat and we wanted to show our kids this place since they have never been.  We ordered a Teri Combo, Sweet & Sour Spare Ribs, and Teri Burger. The food was good, but there was a bit of a wait because they were busy.  We would come back if we're ever in the downtown area craving Hawaiian food.

photos.caption: Photo of Aloha Specialties - Las Vegas, NV, United States. They don&#39;t allow you to save seats during busy hours because they seat parties as they order.

J26gsXSP6SEEuoFZb46P1w.text: Disappointed in the wontun saimin, no taste..noodles too soft...Aloha bento was ok...cheeseburger was thin not juicy

photos.caption: Photo of Aloha Specialties - Las Vegas, NV, United States. aloha bento was ok
Photo of Aloha Specialties - Las Vegas, NV, United States. wunton min .. broth lacked any flavor and noodles too soggy
Photo of Aloha Specialties - Las Vegas, NV, United States. cheeseburger too thin not juicy

1Lz9ffegFZ-bBhPq67EYng.text: Food: (-1star) Definitely a Hawaiian local favorite. If you walk into a restaurant and most of the customers you see are Hawaiian, that tells you something right?  -Local plate: the chicken was good. The beef didn't have enough of that charbroiled flavor/texture (not enough heat) and they pan-fried instead. Their teriyaki sauce was quite good though. Light yet still holds that flavor and spice in it. Musubi has too much rice but was still quite good. I finished it. Go figure. -Loco Moco: Hamburger meat a bit dry but flavorful. Egg wasn't over soft/medium cooked (runny) like it should but over hard. Over-fried is more like it. So this is main part i didn't like about this dish. Their gravy was actually good and worked perfectly.  Overall, i actually liked this place more than a few places i had in Maui. Just cost alone made me happier here.  Price:  Very descent. Loco moco plate ($7.50) and Local plate ($10) which has teriyaki beef & chicken and 2pc of spam musubi. Their portions are very generous too!  Ambiance: Very casual. As you walk in, seems like a regular dine in pad but you actually go order first and pay, then go grab your own table. They have a water table where you can serve yourself and they will bring you your utensils. Place is clean but very casual like where it may seem unclean and a hole in a wall to some. Generally a laid back place.   I do want to say this place may be more 3.5 than a 4 and not that bad to be a 3. Knowing for the good bang for your buck, portion and i know ill be coming back despite a few flaws, i kept it at 4 stars.

photos.caption: Photo of Aloha Specialties - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Loco Moco with over hard eggs. Main part i didn&#39;t like about dish. Otherwise, was good
Photo of Aloha Specialties - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Loco Moco ($7.50)
Photo of Aloha Specialties - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Help yourself water station

nk1cyfln0Y3B-pHMlEP8Dg.text: The second highest population of Hawaiians are located at The California Hotel in Vegas. It's True! If you've been at this hotel, you'll know what I'm talking about. You know this place is good since you'll notice the amount of old timers here.   Aloha Specialties is my must visit when I'm in town. It's the same order every time. Garlic chicken served crispy on both sides. Gravy on the side. Comes with three slabs of chicken, rice, and mac salad. Hawaiian Sweet Punch is a definite must. One of these days, I'm going to ask them to spike it with vodka. I always forget to ask.   Nothing fancy. Just good comfort food and friendly people.

photos.caption: Photo of Aloha Specialties - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Garlic chicken.. Crispy. My definite must when I&#39;m in town.

pBYQzAstkY3eLs6p9ktnLw.text: QUALITY hawaiin food, cheap, fast service especially being in vegas. Large portions of food (at least for us) and everything was so tasty. Lady that was working allowed me to buy a side of mushroom and onions even though it wasn't on the menu, got the mix plate and a musubi it was delicious!

M1iHw_aXZOKGBLx9sCQAcg.text: A Hawaii plate lunch oasis in the dessert. Friendly people, large plates and a convenient location make for popular spot on the bridge between The Cal and Main Street Station. Spam musubis are available as well as a great Mac salad. Generous scoops!

7VtlfDv4C8JdGIEfTnd8Ew.text: We never miss coming to this place on every trip, our family ritual, good comfort food for the soul.

oP-NJrk9QlxYm9Bmd6ykMQ.text: Good solid Hawaiian food if your craving for something different in Vegas. Friendly service and a relaxed atmosphere. Would definitely recommend and revisit in the near future. Plus who doesn't like Fremont street!!!

6SkwSSWHu3l88UmPBnMoVQ.text: I told myself Im not eating a hamburger steak when Im in Las Vegas because i always can get it back home anytime i want. Well I couldnt pass this place up This restaurant is located on the 2nd level of the California Hotel. After gambling a few nights  I was craving a hamburger steak and boy was I happy with this. The first night they were sold out of hamburger steak and loco mocos and tripe stew. I was so sad so we walked out because I just wanted a hamburger steak. So here comes the next night it was late and I was drunk LOL so i sat down and my mama order me a saimin. WOW that thing is huge and it was so perfect after having a few drinks downstairs. The mususbis was pretty good too... Well here comes Saturday night we had a party of 10 and we all got to sit together we just had a few people sit while the rest got to order. I finally got my hamburger steak this plate is huge it comes with one patty which is a nice size white rice and mac salad. Im a hamburger steak lover thats my go to at most restaurants here in Hawaii. When you walk in you will see the menu on the wall and stand in line and order. Take a number and have a seat they will bring your food to you....The staff are nice and friendly... This is a PEPSI hotel.... BOOOO... Downtown restaurants are all PEPSI....bring the COKE in please... Thank YOU,,,, i will be back soon

photos.caption: Photo of Aloha Specialties - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Saimin $6.50
Photo of Aloha Specialties - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Hamburger steak

QBY1H2hVuo2B2x1zfCE8UA.text: This review is long overdue as I've been here more times than I can count, over the years.   The California Hotel & Casino is like the capital of the 9th Hawaiian island, known as Las Vegas. If you're from Hawaii, you know this to be the truth! Take a stroll thru the casino - the odds of hitting the lottery are better than never seeing someone from Hawaii.   Anyway - some locals like to go the California to eat at Aloha Specialties. Somewhat reasonable prices for decent portions. This last visit, I had a bowl of Saimin with won ton and a side of macaroni salad. The Saimin broth is ok but the noodles are a little thick and a little chewy. Won tons - too much dough. I prefer to have more meat filling. A little on the chewy side too. To clarify - not a crunchy chew but bordering under cooked pasta. Al dente.  Macaroni salad - made with too much mayo. I love mayo but if you take a look at my pics, it was like instead of using one entire container of Costco size mayo, two were used.   Walking in - get in line to place your order then find seating. No table service. Your order is brought out and if you want water or refills, there's a water station. I can't speak as to refills as I opted for water.   I know I have posted other reviews that are critical of "Hawaiian" restaurants. This one is no exception. Having been born and raised in Hawaii - I'm not a fan of this place and I only went because family was craving one of the dishes served there.

photos.caption: Photo of Aloha Specialties - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Side: Macaroni Salad
Photo of Aloha Specialties - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Large Saimin with Won Ton

QL4Y_z26TvaVoVkWlDyV4Q.text: Went here for breakfast because the lines at the other restaurants were extremely long and minimum-wait was half an hour. Decided to give it a try and surprisingly was not disappointed. I order the " loco moco" and was not disappointed. It was freaking huge about the size of the bowl  and very Onolicious. Gravy could have more flavor tho. My dad had the three egg omelette and again it was a lot of food to eat. The taste was great and flavorful. Prices mediocre and staff help was courteous and friendly. Only downside is that I believe they might use MSG. (Only my stomach can tell me when it's preset in food, when asked if they use MSG replied no). Other than that it was a great experience and good food. Jafaga808

photos.caption: Photo of Aloha Specialties - Las Vegas, NV, United States
Photo of Aloha Specialties - Las Vegas, NV, United States

eeXzqXX05wZVgdbuyJTXSA.text: Plan your trip to Fremont Street around a meal time so you can eat here! Great food at a reasonable priced served by friendly people; can't ask for more. Will definitely keep this place in mind for future downtown visits.

9oeLU4ImtEp9qdNR2eXiPQ.text: Its Vegas time again!!!    On my most recent trip to the Ninth Island, I hit three places I want to share.  I finally dropped by here after I started Yelping.  Aloha Specialties is in the California Hotel in DT Vegas.  The hotel caters to junkets from Hawai'i, and AS offers local, casual cuisine.  I ordered the Aloha Bento ($10.95 - Teri beef, Redondo hot dog, korean spiced chicken & mahi mahi over furikake rice).  In addition, I got a side of mac salad ($1.95).  My wing man ordered the chicken tofu saimin ($6.95) w/ wun tuns ($1.50).  The bento was a ton of food!  However, none of the items really wowed you.  In addition, the mahi mahi was buried under tartar sauce.  Nonetheless, its hard to get Redondo brand sausages & hot dogs on the mainland:  3.5 Stars.  Secondarily, the mac salad was excellent.  It was made w/ Hellmans vs Best Foods, and you could taste the difference.  But the portion was so big, I was stuffed afterwards.  I'd rather have a smaller portion of mac salad, and remove one of the proteins, or give less rice in the bento.  There is way too much rice in the bento:  4 Stars.  Lastly, my wingman really liked his saimin.  The portion was large, the noodles were chewy, and you received a ton of wun tuns for $1.50:  5 Stars.  Regarding the ambiance, it is a traditional, casual Hawaiian place.  The only difference is they bring the food to you:  4 Stars.  On the other hand, I thought the cashier was giving me attitude at first, but I realized she just had a "bitchy resting face" - a la youtube - LOL!  She was actually nice, as was the waitress who brought our food:  4 Stars.  I know of no better place to enjoy Hawaiian grinds close to the strip.  In addition, if you find yourself in the California Hotel between 11 pm & 9 am, the coffee shop downstairs serves oxtail stew - Ono grinds!!!

photos.caption: Photo of Aloha Specialties - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Aloha bento plate ($10.95) ono!
Photo of Aloha Specialties - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Side of mac salad ($1.95)
Photo of Aloha Specialties - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Chicken tofu saimin ($6.95) w/ wun tuns ($1.50)

23lN35dq1b1J7GejM-HrSQ.text: Yes yes remodeled nicely! Loco Moco for the boy with side of Mac salad.. me 2 eggs with Portuguese sausage. Nice way to start the morning. Getting. Use in here now at 11 am. We always like eating here. Quality, quantity and great service. It's nice for a few yrs now they take cards.

photos.caption: Photo of Aloha Specialties - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Loco moco background , Mac salad.  Eggs n porchegese  sausage
Photo of Aloha Specialties - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Must be good cops are eatin here!!

GmgAHYs0nFqc0h23uKsxfQ.text: I am a huge fan of the Kalua Pork and Garlic Chicken. I love how both entrees are full of flavor. So yummy and tasty. For some reason, I always order Raspberry Tea whenever I go here and I never order it anywhere else. It is totally a psychological thing or maybe it just goes well with my meal. Who knows?   I recommend anyone to check this place out. It is one of my favorite Hawaiian food restaurants. When I used to be a tourist, I would always made the effort to go to Downtown just to eat at Aloha Specialities.   Only sucky thing is it is CASH ONLY. So remember to bring some money with you.

uDaAAx-bCtjgmYpteyFmJg.text: Love this place... a must when I'm in Vegas.  Very good food for very cheap.  Their plates and soups are huge portions.  I really love the Saimin (noodle soup) here, the broth has a lot of flavor and the noodles are perfect.  The Beef Stew is pretty good, but I love the Kalua Pig & Cabbage and Teriyaki Beef & Chicken.  Don't forget to try Ethel's Chocolates across the way and the Shaved Ice at the Ice Cream shop.

M7ch7d8tS7p_dlSugBZIeA.text: We always eat here where in Vegas the food is good and the price is excellent .we always order the aloha vento the best plate.

AHVA30Wmn4n-QC6cVII_5w.text: After spending three days partying our faces off on the strip we were mighty homesick on our last day in Vegas. I heard from my best travel buddy Yelp that there was Hawaiian food in the California Hotel, for anyone not from Hawaii, Vegas is the 9th island and the California is the capital.  I was hoping for a full Hawaiian plate, unfortunately they didn't have that special, but they did have POKE, and it was good! The food was yummy, the rice was cooked right (a must), and the portions were gigantic.  I really loved hearing everyone talking pidgin and wearing slippers, it made the last half of my trip and the freezing weather more bearable since I got a taste of home.

6DyQSD2asE5Kpob-xFy7nA.text: My friends and I come here as a traditional goodbye lunch before heading on home from Vegas.  It's a drive from the strip considering it is inside the California Hotel.  It's apparently a popular place to go for lunch so it's best to go there early if you're really hungry.  The food comes out relatively quick and it's tasty.  I ordered the teriyaki plate for $7.25 and they give you a good amount of food.  Ask if you can get double chicken or double pork and exclude the pork chop.  The pork is hard and is a pain to eat.  The teri sauce is good and not overly sweet.

f5rlvcl65RvUfJE1_mK6hg.text: Hawaiian food for the soul.  Environment: Located on the second floor of the Cal. It's an open restaurant that has seating "outside" (aka in the hotel walkway) but small. Expect a wait on crowded weekends, especially tournament weekend! Order and pay, and they will deliver the food to you. They bus your tables for you.  Food: I've always loved their saimin, but this year I was sad that my saimin wasn't HOT. It was warm. The noodles were great like usual, but the broth tasted like tap water. Bummer. After I added my shoyu and hot mustard, I was in saimin heaven. We ordered a side of kim chee (pass on this) which was not good and probably out of a grocery store jar and a side of mac salad which was good BUT had too much mayo and was too salty for my liking. The mac salad had good texture, crunch, and color though. The portions are huge! My bro ordered the small saimin and it was comparable to a regular portion at any ramen house in socal. I ordered the chicken and tofu saimin and I think it's served in a large bowl. The chicken was moist (thigh meat?) and the tofu was regular cooked tofu. The haupia was firm but the flavor was bland.  Why four stars? Nothing compares to my grandma's cooking, but if I'm in Vegas, this is as good as it gets for Hawaiian food, especially saimin.

HSzAEJWFZMjF4GPhVpYSzA.text: Good place for some local Hawaii food. First time to try the saimin and I didn't like it at all. Good thing I also ordered the teriburger. My husband ordered the cheeseburger and liked that too. Earlier in the week we also tried the liver and onions, tripe stew, spareribs, and beef stew. We loved the tripe stew and liver and onions. Just missing some poi.

HZUKrpURCQ-rcL5FHGLqBQ.text: This is a must go spot for me whenever I go to Las Vegas.  I go specifially for the saimin, since it's hard to find quality saimin in CA.  They import their noodles from Maebo Noodle Co., which just makes a huge difference compared to most places that serve saimin.  The noodles have a bit of a chew to it.  Service can be a bit slow and inattentive at times, mainly because the place is always packed to the rafters no matter the time of day.

MYOY_sj5Qh3zP-xsJDjG0A.text: Hawaiian food at the Cal.  The Musubi's make for good snacks.  The ochazuke special is good.  They are really busy all the time, so it may take a while to get your food and to order.  But if you know the trick...you can get your food fast.  And across the way they sell the best mini frog gummies!!!

0cyhmH4ZmT5gu05K798y3Q.text: My favorite Hawaiian Restaurant.  I always have a hard time deciding what to get here.  I end up over ordering every time.  I even order a bunch of Spam Musabi's to go.  They taste so good driving back to LA.  Right around Barstow, it's the perfect time to bust those out.  My wife said she only wants a bite of one, but she always ends up eating one and a half.  So I order Four to go at least.  This way I get my Full Two, and stare at her to not finish, so I could get half of her second one.  =)

SuOmvUz9ew_gJwTw7LS52Q.text: This place is alright! Nothing to call home about, really! The location couldnt be better as every hawaii family knows when they stay at the Cal you can eat Hawaiian food just as you just left Hawaii and have all the same choices you would have in hawaii! Its hawaii food all over again!

eCd5mECNAz5ZJO2mQYdD0g.text: Flipping delicious best hangover food ever.  I used to work at L&L and I love this place more.

-vD0Hxg0L2RAwHbFCZtWtA.text: I'd have to agree with one of the lower posts about how this place would be soso in Hawaii, but given that this place serves up some good local food and that it is in Vegas, there isn't much to complain about this place.  Just got back from Vegas and ended up eating there twice.  I highly recommend the beef stew, spam musubis and side teri-chicken.  Also think the Portuguese sausage eggs and rice is a great thing to have for breakfast after waking up at 4:00pm.  Yum

EZ0hSOUkt6wjSpTA6jLBXg.text: I was first introduced to Aloha Specialties about 5 years ago and have been in love every since. This small restaurant, located Downtown Las Vegas, has some of the BEST Hawaiian food I have ever consumed. Not exactly heart healthy, but its a definite a cure for your island craving. I have tried nearly everything on the menu once or twice. I highly recommend the Siam-in, which at most places is a miss, but A.S hits it right on. The super bowls are huge and under $5, and the combination plates range but are under $10. The Teri Sauce is like NO other!  I would happily pour it on a human arm and consume it!  But the item that has me coming back (as often as my waistline will allow) is the macaroni salad. I have never been a fan of mac salad, but they made a believer out of me. Sure its loaded with lard and not much else, but its so delicious that the second it touches my lips any weight concerns go out the window. Give it a try, you wont be disappointed!

RlxWOZ2-daInf3nLkhpb7w.text: Was surprised how many Hawaiian natives are praising this place. The mixed plate and Poke were both drowned in sauce to the point that the meal was ruined. It didn't taste like anything I've had in Hawaii, but was fascinated by this strange hotel named after California and filled with Hawaiians. There's a book on the hotel's history and its connection to Hawaii. I also went to try the Shave Ice at the ice cream shop next door, but the machine was broken. What a bust!

SSqHFg59XVFkS-jQ4KUs4w.text: I can't complain about Aloha Specialties..they serve down home delicious Hawaiian food at reasonable prices. Oh, and HUGE portions. I always seem to go during peak hours so the line to order is often out the door, but there's so many menu items that it takes a while to decide what you want. Even when its packed, the service is great and you'll get your food in no time. They are cash only, which is fine, just hit up one of the 10,000 ATMs in downtown. Some of the food may be a little questionable (Fried saimin, actually regular saimin that looks like it was fried for a few seconds & the poke which is drowned in shoyu) but I stick with what I know- Teri cheeseburger & a small saimin. I need my combo fix of that since Washington Saimin closed down in Honolulu.. :(

ncLsSjiooqTpKfpjDGsdHg.text: It's hard not to get a plate lunch here when you're visiting The Cal. I like it because it reminds me of Hawaii and it's cheap! Pretty much everything hear is a winner. Saimin is very good. Always get a spam musubi with the local plate. Rather spend $10 bucks on good food than dropping it on the table.

KYjVyebhiSoNOTsPiOzt_g.text: they are not that bad. their food portions are huge. too bad they dont accept debit/credit cards. they add more veggies to their siamin.

9aYhwG6MiSGrOdKgeogLhA.text: Who woulda thought the "California" hotel would have a Hawaiian joint in it?  Actually it's "themed" after Hawaii..... what the heck, it's Vegas, baby!  I had the MIX plate with Chicken, Beef, Mahi Mahi, mac salad (of course), rice and I added a fried egg on top....we be grubbin'.....Typical fanfare here, did try the Poki, lotsa marinade here w/ big chunks a tuna n some green onions, I favor the "drier" version w/ white onions n seaweed salad in it.  The Kahlua pork was tastier than most I've had outside of the Islands.... very BIG plates here!  So be hungryyyyyyy or share plates. I heard someone say the Tripe stew is good here, but they were out for the night.  So I gotta go back n try it, my curiosity wants to sample it.... after stuffin your face here, you can top it off with some Lappert's Ice Cream or some Beef Jerky next door.  til next time....Aloha!  For some reason, my meats weren't cut up like the other plates, so i had to slice it up, what up wit dat?

VBgiqcLmx0PMPwejJKbCmg.text: If you are tired of all you can eat buffets and need a change in Vegas, this is a great place to go.  I would have never have known about this place unless my friends brought me here. It's a nice change from the strip restaurants located upstairs on the corner in the Calfornia Casino in downtown Las Vegas.  Food is great! Very reasonable for "local" Hawaiian food. Bare in mind it does get crowded on the weekends especially in the morning or lunch time. It NOTHING fancy cafeteria style dining and small.

CqfDAshqVPBIUdbo0zoBmg.text: Great Hawaiian eats place located on the 2nd floor mezzanine area of the California Hotel downtown. I love getting the large Saimin, an order of poke, and a slice of Haupia. Yes, I do eat it all. They also have great plate lunches, or dinners depending whateva time you come to eat da local grindz.

j1ipnFOG6k7Z2w-_AeJbtw.text: We love this place! Can't go to Vegas without stopping by. Huge portions at a good price.  My son really likes the saimin here, he gets it every time. The Korean Chicken is my favorite. It's a little spicy but it hits me just right. The loco moco was very good. My husband liked it but said the patties that I make are tastier. Their gravy is very good. The bentos are very large...everything is very large here.  Our favorite part is the price. It's cheap and the servings are so large and tasty. Enough to share plates. We often eat family style here. BRING CASH!! They don't take cards.

Z1HhOxKlZfpYZNO6CExDvA.text: We've been coming here for DECADES. The food never disappoints and price is reasonable. The folks here are usually very friendly and hospitable. But the speed of the service is something they have to get a handle on. On our recent visit, it took over 20 minutes to order and over 30 minutes to get our food. It was 3pm on a Sunday afternoon and the line was not unusually long either. It was painfully slow and it didn't make for a great dining experience. This may be sacrilegious to say, especially to the regulars (and there are MANY), but they need to get off of Hawaiian Time or hire more people. I'll keep coming back, but this is not how I'd run a business.

Fq1x4O2JPCZn-EWRPQ7dSQ.text: My family has been coming here for over 20 years. I love their Mac salad...it has so much flavor. I compare all Mac salad to this one. I love the Local Plate, and Korean chicken, but I wish they still served Poke. I'm super picky with Hawaiian food! This place is a True hidden gem!

6uq6MdiXJW3aahcEKXPi1A.text: Visited this place during CES. It is nothing much to look at but the food was great. Beef teriyaki was good. I had the hamburger steak dinner and it was huge. My whole dinner was $15.95, which in Vegas terms was free. I would recommend this place to anyone, although if you're staying on the strip your cab ride will cost double the cost of dinner.

-uATMe02Sj_m_wq9aEpg7g.text: I love, love, love how the California casino/hotel caters to the Hawaiian community.  And Local and transplant Hawaiians reciprocate by visiting this hotel almost exclusively it seems!  Therefore, we always make it a point to visit this place when we are downtown. We stumbled upon this place at the mezzanine level of the casino and saw a long line forming out the door that just kept growing.  Of course  we had to try out the food here even though we ate not 2 hours  ago.  I had the special: Ochoa zuke#1:  tea , rice, Teri chicken, spam, fishcake, Saba (mackerel) and assorted pickles... $9.99 -nicely done and presented in bento box.  EVERYTHING was YUMMMMMMM...  -ahi poke: fresh ahi tuna marinated in soy sauce, sugar, limu, green onions etc.. Generous portions and very fresh.  -coffee was 50 cents and my hubby was shocked.  There really isn't an 'ambiance' here, it's basically a "mom and pop" Hawaiian style cafe in a casino which for the California hotel, is quite suitable!   Cash only.

photos.caption: Photo of Aloha Specialties - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Ahi poke $4.50!!!! Wha?????
Photo of Aloha Specialties - Las Vegas, NV, United States

pFG1_II1xPJS4Y8yBYzDSg.text: You can't go wrong with a True Hawaiian restaurant inside of the only hotel in Las Vegas that caters to the Hawaiian customer.  If anyone knows anything about Sam Boyd and his love for Hawaiian then you will appreciate and understand why this hotel would have some of the best local Hawaiian food in Las Vegas.  I have never been disappointed eating here, maybe the only thing that bothers me is they don't accept credit cards, CASH only.  It is located on the second floor of the California hotel and casino in downtown Las Vegas just a block from Fremont Street.  If you are in downtown and want some good Hawaiian food then please give this place a try and you won't be disappointed.  Some of my favorites include Spam Musubi, Kalua Pork, Saimin, Beef Teriyaki bowl, and the Mahi Mahi Sandwhich; along with daily specials you can'it go wrong.  Aloha.

photos.caption: Photo of Aloha Specialties - Las Vegas, NV, United States. saimin soup...small was too much food.

HmcPfOIcp4CxhpXXqChe_Q.text: Bomb! Went walking to this place with my friends from LA. I insisted on making them try it since I saw the high yelp reviews. We finally find it after walking around downtown lost, hungover, and hungry.  It was all worth it thou. Very casual setting in a beat up old casino. Out ordered garlic chicken covered in gravy. BEST!!! Hawaiian gravy I have ever had. The staff was very nice, and the food came out fast.  Its always a good sign when you walk in and the place is full of Hawaiian customers. I just wish they had chicken katsu. :( Overall,  a diamond in the rough of downtown las vegas

ZgwEVaZDUq1EKUkEh5I1ig.text: I came here because it had 4 stars and cheap prices. I got the chicken teriyaki sandwich with macaroni salad. The sandwich was basic, but okay. It's two fried chicken patties, a piece of lettuce, and a tomato. It comes with macaroni salad, which was warm and kinda slimy in my opinion, with very little color. I was not impressed with this meal, but I got all that and a green tea for $5.50, so I can't complain.

RG-d8uqAp1SmX6T0l-fgJA.text: In the time it took for the food to be served (40+ mins) I could've bought the ingredients and cooked a better version myself.

4T_C9CGHMQlmxHRfxBddew.text: Friendly service, very decent portions and tasty food.  Bring your appetite and CASH, they don't accept plastic or player's club cards.  Anyone homesick for Hawaiian plate lunch should be happy here.  Just note their hours and the cash-only and you'll be fine.

ViFE6n8KBnhDCih0XLT-9w.text: I love how this place is right across from lapperts! Seriously the perfect dessert after having the Korean chicken here!  During lunch and dinner this place is pretty busy. I highly recommend the Korean chicken! You seriously cannot go wrong with this plate of yummy goodness!   I haven't tried anything else here but I will definitely be back. They have awesome service and delicious food.

Vv147h8nrKGnr0A7oR7z1A.text: I took the Deuce from the Strip to Downtown in search of some good Hawaiian food. Given the hour of misery I spent on the bus, there was a heightened expectation.  Initially I went over to Market Street Cafe at California Hotel, but saw that they were busy. I noticed the sign for Aloha Specialties however, so I went upstairs to the 2nd floor of the California to try this place out.  Aloha Specialties is a very casual place. There are a fair number of tables inside the restaurant with a few right outside on the mezzanine. The offerings here, all of which are cheap would be something you would find at the plate lunch places in Hawaii. Things like Spam musubi, macaroni salad, saimin and meat plates.  I tried the ahi poke ($4.95) which was on special, the flash rice bowl with chicken and beef ($3.25) and washed it down with some raspberry tea ($1.50). My order came out wiki (fast).  The ahi poke portion is very generous. Big chunks of ahi with big pieces of onion and plenty of soy sauce. A very traditional version of this dish. This is salty, so make sure that if you order it that you get a side to counter this. Liked it well enough, though I am a fan of spicy and sweet versions of poke. The rice bowl was cheap and filling. Meats were tasty drenched with the sweet teriyaki sauce. It is reminiscent of the teriyaki you find around Seattle.  If you are looking for a taste of Hawaii in Vegas, Aloha Specialties fits the bill. Good food and service with aloha.

cDY4qTeRuySFZIZwmOOUPA.text: Decided to try this place for lunch based on the Yelp reviews and I also work downtown.  After eating here, I really don't get the hype about this place.  I order the Loco Moca, it was just ok. I had much better at other places around town. Will have to give it another shot and try something else on the menu.

jwCJGJFyimV68p5INZ6KcQ.text: Simple, cheap, and tasty.  If you are going to visit this restaurant, you will probably want to beat the lunch crowd rush as the line goes outside the door.  I usually go around 11:30 or so where you can just walk up to the register and order.  The food is very typical of a hawaiian plate lunch, but it makes its teriyaki chicken like a katsu instead of just simply BBQing it.  All in all, it is very good, very cheap, and very Hawaiian.

rz8YCjtKEBbfpCQLhTIUjA.text: Great local food!! If you have a need to get your Hawaii fix in this is the place!! The aloha bento is best, also try the Korean chicken!

x4kd3Y9T2E4WkqcbaDerxg.text: Awesome place to get something that reminds you of that Hawaiian soul food. Now really great food for what you pay. Also if you have kids send them to the small arcade or to get some ice cream. Musubi is easy and fun to take with you around Vegas. Love this place

zHG4eOUNzZIRS7QRiuaSDw.text: This is truly ono OHANA food. My OHANA and I eat here alot.  A True locals establishment. One thing I will warn you about the food portions are huge. Wear your most comfortable clothes cause when you pau eating your tummy is gonna smile. Aloha

photos.caption: Photo of Aloha Specialties - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Mahalo nui loa
Photo of Aloha Specialties - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Moms dolls
Photo of Aloha Specialties - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Wahine&#39;s

BIUwsSfspHRIyPY5yppbvg.text: I was a first timer here but loved what they offered. The food was amazing and the service was great. I ordered the Korean chicken and was able to take a lot to go still. The portions were huge and the prices were reasonable. I just wished the set up of the restaurant was better and a little more updated. Other than that, it's a good place to go for some Hawaiian food.

4uLnM_YjsnNcAMzS33_sAQ.text: They have big portions! I ordered a beef chop steak and my eyes widened when I saw the serving size. Luckily for me, I had a small breakfast and a late lunch so I ate a lot. But I still needed a takeaway box. I gave 3 stars because I did not like the macaroni salad and they only accept cash.

photos.caption: Photo of Aloha Specialties - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Beef chop steak

J3eQFscd4UFoPU_i2zQSRA.text: This is our favorite restaurant for Hawaiian food. It's located inside the California Hotel/Casino (a popular place with Hawaiian tourists due to Sam Boyd's longtime marketing specials) in the downtown area, where you park in the parking garage, take your ticket, take the elevators down to the casino, and then self-validate the ticket at the counter. Take the escalators up (2nd floor) to the restaurant. You stand in line (the menu is on the wall, making it easy to choose what you want), place your order and pay, get a number, select a table or booth, where a server brings you your food. There is seating right outside the restaurant wheren you can people watch as they walk by. Due to its popularity, it does get crowded very easily. We've been coming here for years. (Save room for ice cream- Lappert's is across the way- that's what we do, every time.) And just so you know, we've been to Hawaii many times, so we are very familiar with Hawaiian food. I also have a Grandmother from Hawaii.    I've had the saimin (large bowl- I can only eat half of it), korean chicken (spicy, just a warning for the mild folks out there- I've been ordering this dish more lately), and the teriyaki plate (order it skinless, just a tip). The plates come with macaroni salad  (yummy) and a couple scoops of rice. Everything is really good. All the Hawaiian drinks are available (like Pass-O-Guava). It's very reasonable. If you're looking for ambiance, this is not a place for a great setting. (I just wanted to mention that because there are some people out there that love that sort of thing.) It's a simple place where you get really good Hawaiian food at reasonable prices. Also, the portions are pretty big- I usually bring home leftovers. Unless it is crowded, service is great. No complaints here. I don't think that I've had a bad meal here, ever, over the years. They do catering.  The location is especially good because it is not in the super-busy (and sometimes pricier) Strip. It's a gem in the desert.

4aW2wcOXGPXDNpid0Q6wyw.text: This is my most favorite Hawaiian restaurant. This is located inside the california hotel second floor. If you are a fond of hawaiian food, this is a must try. The meats are all fresh everything is very good! I would suggest ordering the Teriyaki Plate, very good along with their Mac salad. It is a bit pricey but well worth it, portions are pretty big as well. Try now! you will not be disappointed.

y130B8jicn63jQYHk2czvA.text: I kept hearing about this place from my friends and Yelp buddies, so we checked it out for lunch one day.
